paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Hive Joins
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive joins
**File locations:** /labs/data/
**Successful outcome:** Understanding hive Joins
**Before you begin:** N/A
**Related lessons:** Hive Joins

---

%md
# Setup

paragraphs.title: Copy the data in HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
hdfs dfs -chmod -R 777 /user/zeppelin

hdfs dfs -rm /labs/data/title.basics.tsv
hdfs dfs -put /opt/labs/data/title.basics.tsv /labs/data/
hdfs dfs -rm /labs/data/title.crew.tsv
hdfs dfs -put /opt/labs/data/title.crew.tsv /labs/data/
hdfs dfs -rm /labs/data/name.basics.tsv
hdfs dfs -put /opt/labs/data/name.basics.tsv /labs/data/
hdfs dfs -rm /labs/data/title.ratings.tsv
hdfs dfs -put /opt/labs/data/title.ratings.tsv /labs/data/

paragraphs.title: Create the movies database

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Lab

paragraphs.text:
%md
We are going to create a materialized view using a table join.

~~~
Create a materialized view  mv_movie_ratings that joins tables movie_title and rating. 
Include only the movies that have a start year after 2001 and an average rating greater than 5.5. (Limit to 5 rows.) 
~~~

But first we need to drop the materialized view if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 4 - Drop and Create the materialized view
5 - Execute a Query on the materialized view

paragraphs.text:
%md
###Optional Challenge:
Try to join the movie_title, rating and movie_crew and movie_crew_info

paragraphs.title: Optional Challenge:

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created a join in Hive

---

%md
# Solution
---

paragraphs.title: 1 - Use movies database and create a join for movie_title and rating title using the tconst key. Show the title type, primary title ,original title and average rating(Limit 5 rows)
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
Select movie_title.titleType, movie_title.primaryTitle, movie_title.originalTitle, ratings.averageRting from movie_title JOIN ratings ON (movie_title.tconst=ratings.tconst) limit 5;

paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Hortonworks Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Hortonworks Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.
